Strengthening the Financial Management and Control in Georgia

description.narrative:
Projektet "Strengthening the Financial Management and Control (FMC)" är ett myndighetssamarbete mellan Central Harmonisation Unit (CHU) inom det georgiska finansministeriet och Ekonomistyrningsverket, ESV. Projektets mål är att öka kunskap och kapacitet att tillämpa ett moderniserat system för finansiell styrning och kontroll och därigenom öka effektiviteten inom den georgiska statsförvaltningen
Projektet kommer under 26 månader att främja utveckling av a) CHU:s organisatoriska kapacitet, samt inom b) fyra centrala ministerier som har börjat implementera ett nytt system för finansiell styrning och kontroll. Insatsen förstärker och kompletterar den pågående budgetreformen som omfattar etablering av programbudgetering i Georgien. FMC-insatsen verkar för etableringen av effektiva managementsystem, vilket utgör en väsentlig byggsten i riktningen mot ett väl fungerande system för programbudgetering.
Samarbetet kring intern styrning och kontroll verkar för att förvaltningen av offentliga medel främjar regeringens mål samt sker i enlighet med lag och regelverk. Detta innebär till exempel att en statstjänsteman som beslutar om nyttjande av statliga medel ska både följa föreskrifterna för intern kontroll och använda medlen ändamålsenligt.
Ett huvudproblem som projektet adresserar gäller brister i förvaltningssystemet gällande ledningsansvar och ansvarsutkrävande. Det georgiska systemet har en kvarvarande stark centralisering med bristande förutsättningar för ansvarsutkrävande och ansvarstagande hos ledare på olika nivåer utvecklat. Projektet riktar sig mot följande svagheter: brist på delegering; otillräcklig målsättning; svag riskhantering; otydlig informations- och rapporteringssystem samt en otydlig verksamhetsroll för finans- och ekonomienheter.

The contribution "Strengthening the Financial Management and Control (FMC) in Georgia" is an agency-to-agency cooperation between the Central Harmonisation Unit (CHU) at the Ministry of Finance (MoF) in Georgia and the Swedish National Financial Management Authority (ESV).
The objective of the project is to increase the knowledge and strengthen the ability to apply managerial control and thus increase effectiveness and efficiency of public entities in Georgia.
The project will work over 26 months to support a) CHU's institutional capacity development and b) four central ministries that have started to implement Financial Management and Control (FMC). FMC is complementary to the ongoing establishment of programme budgeting in Georgia. FMC is concerned with the establishment of effective management systems required to achieve the potential of programme budgeting.
The aim of the FMC reform in Georgia is to provide assurances that spending of public funds meet the objectives of the Government and are managed in accordance with laws and regulations. This means e.g. that civil servants responsible for the use of public funds both follow the prescribed standards of internal control and are using those funds as efficiently and effectively as possible.
The main problem this project addresses is the lack of managerial accountability. At present the system of accountability and responsibility by managers at different levels is not well developed in Georgia. This project addresses the following causes; lack of delegation; insufficient objective setting; weak risk management; inexplicit information and reporting systems and the vague role of the financial/economic department.

description.narrative:
The submitted report covers period from June 1st 2020 to August 31st 2021. The fist two months the project worked in remote format due to worsened the Covid 19 pandemic situation in Georgia. Long Term Adviser (LTA) came to Georgia in September and since then he has been working in Tbilisi.
The project worked and prepared tailor made support to pilot ministries meaning that the project directly approached working groups in each pilot ministries and elaborated and planned different activities with them. Central Harmonisation Unit (CHU) the main counterpart to the ESV and beneficiary of the project introduced benchmarking for pilots.
With the project support was prepared the document "The Rules and Procedures on the Development of Managerial Control" that was shared with stakeholders for comments and feedback and afterwards was sent to the Government for approval.
Another important document towards with the project contributed was Public Internal Financial Control Strategy and Action Plan covering years 2021-2024. The document was endorsed by the Government.
ESV and CHU elaborated a risk manual that gives risk identification cases, who is doing what in the risk process, etc. The manual was introduced to the pilot ministries through workshops and trainings. As a results the risk management in the pilot ministries have been improved.
Within the project a comprehensive description of the budget processes has been written.
